Description: Round-topped limestone stela divided into three registers: 1 - Winged sun-disc. 2 - Scene of the deceased before an offering-table adoring Osiris, Hapy-Osiris, Anubis, Sokar, Isis and Nephthys. 3 - Nineteen columns of Demotic text.
Curator's comments: Young, T. 1828. Hieroglyphics, continued by the Royal Society of Literature; arranged by Thomas Young M.D.F.R.S. Vol. II, pl. 51. London. (facsimile of a much preserved text) J. Quaegebeur, Chronique d'Egypte 49 (1974), 69-70 (no. 23).
Associated names: Named in inscription: Cleopatra the Great
